meanings.definition: A narrow, limited, or parochial perspective or point of view.
meanings.sent1: His provincialism prevented him from appreciating different cultures.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lecture highlighted the dangers of provincialism in modern society.
meanings.sent3: Despite his provincialism, he managed to make friends from around the world.
meanings.sent4: Her provincialism was like a high wall blocking her view of the broader world.
meanings.sent5: The film portrayed the protagonist's provincialism through his reluctance to try new things.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being provincial.
meanings.sent1: The provincialism of the town was evident in its traditional festivals.
meanings.sent2: She found comfort in the familiar provincialism of her hometown.
meanings.sent3: The play humorously exaggerated the provincialism of the local mayor.
meanings.sent4: The provincialism of the small village was a shield against outside influence.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of provincialism in his paintings of rural life.

meanings.definition: A characteristic or trait of being provincial.
meanings.sent1: His provincialism was evident in his reluctance to try new foods.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was hindered by the provincialism of its leadership.
meanings.sent3: Despite her provincialism, she had a kind heart that welcomed all visitors.
meanings.sent4: The provincialism of the old building added to its charm and historical significance.
meanings.sent5: The novel's protagonist struggled to overcome his own provincialism to pursue his dreams.
